items.title: FC Twente bouwt bekertempel in spelershome: 'Hangt ook een rode badjas bij'
items.summary: Bart van Rooij nam in het Eurojackpot KNVB Bekerduel met FC Utrecht de assist voor het winnende doelpunt voor zijn rekening. De rechtsback benadrukte dat het bekertoernooi een hot topic is in de kleedkamer van FC Twente. In het spelershome van de Tukkers komt iedere week een attribuut bij.

items.title: Berichtgeving over Van Hooijdonk ontkracht, Kees Smit houdt regie
items.summary: De winterse transfermarkt is geopend. In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in Nederland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in het buitenland.

items.title: 'Komst Ten Hag is geweldig voor FC Twente'
items.summary: Ook Jan Streuer was zeer verrast toen hij hoorde dat Erik ten Hag interesse had in zijn baan: die van technisch directeur bij FC Twente. In het begin van dit seizoen hadden de twee nog contact over een andere positie binnen de club.

items.title: Transfers Feyenoord: Voor Timber liggen alle opties nog op tafel
items.summary: VI volgt het transfernieuws bij Feyenoord op de voet, zeker nu de winterse transferwindow in aantocht is. De doelwitten van de Rotterdammers, duiding van de clubwatcher, of aandacht in buitenlandse media. We verzamelen alles hier.

items.title: Quinten Timber: 'De druk is gigantisch, heerlijk'
items.summary: Dit kan zomaar het laatste interview zijn met Quinten Timber (24) als speler van Feyenoord, maar misschien ook wel niet. De middenvelder praat over zijn contractsituatie, de sportieve crisis, het aanvoerderschap, over hoe snel hoogte- en dieptepunten voorbijtrekken in een carri√®re en kijkt toch ook al een klein beetje terug op zijn tijd in De Kuip. ‚ÄòNatuurlijk heb ik mijn dromen, maar hoe het loopt is toch echt Gods plan.‚Äô

items.title: Raducanu fights back in Hobart to win first match since September
items.summary: Emma Raducanu earned her first victory since September after fighting back to beat Camila Osorio in straight sets in the first round of the Hobart International.

items.title: Pep rants over VAR on disallowed Semenyo goal
items.summary: Pep Guardiola said he expects an explanation from referees' chief Howard Webb during a post-match rant after Antoine Semenyo's disallowed goal during a Manchester City win over Newcastle United on Tuesday.

items.title: Rosenior plans talks with Chelsea exile Sterling
items.summary: \Chelsea boss Liam Rosenior said he intends to hold talks with Raheem Sterling and Axel Disasi over their futures Stamford Bridge.

items.title: Man United name Carrick boss until end of season
items.summary: Manchester United have appointed former player Michael Carrick as their head coach until the end of the season, the club confirmed Tuesday.

items.title: Klopp: Xabi's Madrid exit 'nothing to do with me'
items.summary: J√ºrgen Klopp has stated that he has not received any calls from Real Madrid following the exit of Xabi Alonso, and affirmed that the decision has nothing to do with him.

items.title: Semenyo scores again - who are winners and losers of his arrival?
items.summary: Antoine Semenyo has taken to life seamlessly at Manchester City by hitting the ground running and is already beginning to repay the ¬£62.5m fee Pep Guardiola handed to Bournemouth to sign him.

items.title: The three ages of Michael Carrick ‚Ä¶ and what they say about Manchester United
items.summary: From his competitive debut to his first spell as interim, the former midfielder has seen much at Old Trafford over the past two decades 23 August 2006, Charlton 0-3 Manchester United The 25‚Äëyear‚Äëold new signing was eased into United‚Äôs midfield as a second-half substitute in the second game of the season, having picked up a small injury on the pre‚Äëseason tour. With Wayne Rooney and Paul Scholes suspended, Sir Alex Ferguson started with John O‚ÄôShea and Darren Fletcher in central midfield, with the Scot (sporting a mullet) opening the scoring after Ryan Giggs and Cristiano Ronaldo had hit the woodwork. Carrick was one of four future United managers in the side, alongside Fletcher, Giggs and Ole Gunnar Solskj√¶r, who rounded off the win with a late goal after Louis Saha had doubled United‚Äôs lead. Solskj√¶r‚Äôs goal was his first in the league in three injury-hit years, and the Norwegian, also a substitute, should have had another when Carrick squared a perfect pass to the striker, only for Charlton‚Äôs Scott Carson to make an outstanding save. With Carrick an instant success at United that season, the club roared to the title in May 2007, their first in four years. Continue reading...

items.title: 'The game has gone' - a bad night for VAR in semi-final
items.summary: Manchester City's 2-0 win over Newcastle in the first leg of the Carabao Cup semi-final was overshadowed by a contentious decision to disallow a goal from Antoine Semenyo in the second half.

items.title: A no-fuss, loyal, safe option: How Man United chose Carrick as head coach
items.summary: A breakfast meeting set the course for the former Man United star to return as their new head coach through the end of the season. How did he get the gig, and what is expected of him?

items.title: 'It will make us stronger' - Pep lists VAR grievances amid Carabao Cup controversy
items.summary: Pep Guardiola unleashed an extraordinary rant at previous VAR calls that have gone against Manchester City following Antoine Semenyo's controversial disallowed goal in their first-leg win at Newcastle.

items.title: Rosenior to talk to Sterling and Disasi about Chelsea exile
items.summary: New Chelsea manager has pledged to speak to Raheem Sterling and Axel Disasi, who were left in limbo by the previous boss.

items.title: Liam Rosenior to hold talks with Sterling and Disasi over Chelsea futures
items.summary: Players had been frozen out under Enzo Maresca Chelsea‚Äôs preference would be to move players on Liam Rosenior will hold talks with Raheem Sterling and Axel Disasi before deciding whether the pair have a future at Chelsea. The head coach, who wants to assess his new squad before con¬≠cluding whether signings are required this month, has been focusing on preparations for the Carabao Cup semi-final first leg at home against Arsenal on Wednesday and has not had a chance to look at whether Sterling and Disasi should be brought back in from the cold. Continue reading...

items.title: Arteta rues Arsenal‚Äôs injury list before Carabao Cup semi-final trip to Chelsea
items.summary: Manager hopes to find ‚Äòsolution‚Äô to defensive problems Saliba and Trossard doubts for first leg on Wednesday Mikel Arteta has acknowledged that Arsenal must overcome their injury problems in defence if they are to maintain their challenge in four competitions. Arteta spoke after ¬≠revealing that William Saliba is a doubt for the first leg of the Carabao Cup semi-final against Chelsea on Wednesday. Saliba and Leandro Trossard did not feature in the FA Cup victory against Portsmouth on Sunday. It was widely thought both had been rested. However, Arteta confirmed on Tuesday that the France defender could miss the game at Stamford Bridge because of an unspecified injury, while ¬≠Trossard is also a doubt. Continue reading...

items.title: Semenyo and Cherki give Manchester City edge over Newcastle after VAR storm
items.summary: Eddie Howe was not exactly overjoyed to learn that, rather than being cup-tied, Antoine Semenyo was free to play for Manchester City here. Sure enough the Newcastle manager‚Äôs worst fears were realised as the winger ‚Äì who played in the competition this season for Bournemouth ‚Äì scored City‚Äôs opener and had another ‚Äúgoal‚Äù disallowed before Rayan Cherki‚Äôs stoppage-time second put the smile back on Pep Guardiola‚Äôs face. Continue reading...

items.title: DeChambeau, Rahm and Smith all committed to LIV Golf for upcoming season
items.summary: Bryson DeChambeau, Jon Rahm and Cam Smith have committed to LIV Golf after Brooks Koepka announced his LIV Golf departure after four seasons with the Saudi-backed circuit.
